### Microsoft Fixes 114 Windows Flaws in January 2026 Patch, One Actively Exploited


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


In January 2026, Microsoft released a significant security update addressing 114 vulnerabilities in its Windows operating system, including a critical flaw that was actively being exploited by cyber attackers. The patch aims to mitigate risks associated with these vulnerabilities, enhancing the overall security framework of Windows. This update underscores Microsoft's ongoing commitment to safeguarding its user base against potential threats and ensuring the integrity and reliability of its software products. Users are encouraged to promptly apply the update to protect their systems from potential exploits and improve their security posture.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/microsoft-fixes-114-windows-flaws-in.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_3214)**

### Go jump in a lake: Measuring the data lake effect on your SIEM


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article explores the integration of data lakes with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems, highlighting the transformative impact on cybersecurity operations. It discusses how data lakes can enhance SIEM capabilities by providing scalable storage and enabling more comprehensive data analysis through enriched context and historical data access. By leveraging the vast storage capacity and flexible data management of data lakes, organizations can optimize threat detection and response, ultimately improving their cybersecurity posture. The article emphasizes the importance of understanding the "data lake effect" to fully harness

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://redcanary.com/blog/security-operations/data-lake-siem/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_3671)**
